buttons.CreateAngleToolUseMessage: Select two lines/segments or three points to calculate an angle.
buttons.CreateAntipodalPointToolUseMessage: Select a location to create a point (if necessary) and its antipode
buttons.CreateCircleToolUseMessage: Click to insert a circle with a given center point and through a second point.
buttons.CreateCoordinateToolUseMessage: Select a point to measure its x,y,z coordinates on the sphere
buttons.CreateIntersectionToolUseMessage: Select two one-dimensional objects to create their intersection point(s).
buttons.CreateLineSegmentToolUseMessage: Click to insert line segment defined by two points.
buttons.CreateLineToolUseMessage: Click to insert a line defined by two points.
buttons.CreatePerpendicularToolUseMessage: Create a perpendicular line to a selected one-dimensional object and selected location.
buttons.CreatePointDistanceToolUseMessage: Select two points to measure the distance between them
buttons.CreatePointOnOneDimToolTipMessage: Select a one-dimensional object to place a point on
buttons.CreatePointOnOneDimToolUseMessage: Select a one-dimensional object to add a point to.
buttons.CreatePointToolUseMessage: Click to insert a free point.
buttons.CreateSegmentLengthToolUseMessage: Click this button to compute the length of Line Segment
buttons.CreateSliderToolUseMessage: Click this button to create a value slider
buttons.DeleteToolUseMessage: Select objects to delete. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.HideObjectToolUseMessage: Select objects to hide. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.MoveObjectToolUseMessage: Click and drag an object to move it. Movable objects include labels, free points, and line segments with antipodal endpoints. Hold the SHIFT key to select from the back of the sphere.
buttons.PanZoomInToolUseMessage: Click to zoom in at the location of the mouse. Click and drag to pan the current view.
buttons.PanZoomOutToolUseMessage: Click to zoom out at the location of the mouse. Click and drag to pan the current view.
buttons.RotateSphereToolUseMessage: Click and drag to rotate the sphere.
buttons.SelectToolUseMessage: Click on objects to select them, hold the Alt key to add to your selection.
buttons.ToggleLabelToolUseMessage: Click on objects to toggle the display of their labels.
buttons.ZoomFitToolUseMessage: Fits the sphere in the available space.

style.backStyleContrastToolTip: By default the back side display style of an object is determined by the front style of that object and the value of the Back Style Contrast. A Back Style Contrast of 1 means there is no color difference between front and back styling. A Back Style Contrast of 0 means that the object is barely visible and its size reduction is maximized.
style.clearChangesToolTip: Revert the selected object(s) back to the style they had when they were *first* selected.
style.clickToMakeLabelsVisible: Click the button below to make all labels visible and then to style them.
style.clickToMakeObjectsVisible: Click the button below to make all objects visible and then to style them.
style.closeOrSelect: Close the styling panel or select object(s).
style.convertSelectionToLabels: A mix of label and non-label objects were selected when all label displays were changed. In order to do this the current selection was converted to all the labels of those objects.
style.dashPatternCheckBoxToolTip: Enable or Disable a dash pattern for the selected objects.
style.differentValues: The selected objects have different values for at least one of these style options. Click the button and edit a style to make all selected objects have that style value in common.
style.differentValuesToolTip: The selected objects have different values for at least one style option. Click the button and edit a style to make all selected objects have that style value in common.
style.differingStylesDetected:
Differing Styles Detected 
 Click To Override
style.differingStylesDetectedToolTip: The selected objects have the different values for this  Click this button and select a style to make all selected objects have this common
style.disableBackStyleContrastSlider: Click To Disable Dynamic Back Style For Selected Object(s)
style.disableBackStyleContrastSliderToolTip: The selected objects have dynamic back style enabled. Click this button disable it for only the selected object(s). Then you can change the back style of the selected object(s) using the style options in this panel.
style.disableDashPatternSliderToolTip: Click this button to set no dash pattern on all selected object(s).
style.disableDynamicBackStyleToolTip: The styling of objects on the back of the sphere is handled automatically unless disabled. The automatic style depends on a Back Styling Contrast percent and the front styling. The contrast is a global variable and applies to all objects the have Dynamic Back Styling enabled. If the contrast is 100%, then there is no difference between the styling of objects on the front and the back of the sphere. If the contrast is 0%, then colors on back of sphere are almost transparent and size reduction is maximized for points and thicknesses. Dash pattern is not effected by the contrast. The Back Contrast percent may be set in the Background Style panel.
style.editMultipleBasicPropertiesMessage: To edit multiple labels simultaneously select the labels directly.
style.enableBackStyleContrastSlider: Click To Enable Dynamic Back Style For Selected Object(s)
style.enableBackStyleContrastSliderToolTip: The selected objects do not have dynamic back style enabled. Click this button enable it and adjust the Back Contrast Slider.
style.enableDashPatternSliderToolTip: The selected object(s) have no dash pattern. Click this button to set a pattern.

labelDisplayModes.labelsNotShowingToolTip: Not all labels in the current selection are visible. Click this button to make them visible and then they will be styleable.
labelDisplayModes.maxMinLabelDisplayCaptionLengthWarning: Must be at most {max} characters long.
labelDisplayModes.maxMinLabelDisplayTextLengthWarning: Must be between 1 and {max} characters long.
labelDisplayModes.moreThanOneItemSelected: Multiple Selected Objects Detected -- Select only one.
labelDisplayModes.moreThanOneItemSelectedToolTip: More than one object is selected, please only select one geometric object to edit its label or select the label directly.
labelDisplayModes.noFillLabelTip: If you want to make the labels only appear on the front of the sphere disable automatic back styling and check 'No Fill' on the Label Back Fill Color. Similarly, to make the labels only appear on the back of the sphere disable automatic back styling and check 'No Fill' on the Label Front Fill Color.
labelDisplayModes.noSelectionToolTip: No objects are currently selected. Either select objects with the selection tool or click this button to close the style panel.
labelDisplayModes.objectsNotShowingToolTip: Not all objects in the current selection are visible. Click this button to make them visible and then they will be styleable.
labelDisplayModes.restoreDefaultsToolTip: Revert the selected object(s) back to their default(s).
labelDisplayModes.selectionDirection1: Click on glowing objects to select them.
labelDisplayModes.selectionDirection2: Hold the Alt/Option key to add or subtract from your selection.
labelDisplayModes.selectionDirection3: Hold a number key to select an object at that depth.
labelDisplayModes.selectionDirection4: Hold the p key and click in any empty location to add all points. Similar for lines (l), line segments (s), and circles (c)
labelDisplayModes.showColorInputsToolTip: Click this to enter color code values directly.
labelDisplayModes.showColorPresetsToolTip: Click this toggle button to enter HSLA values directly or to select a color preset.

handlers.segmentsWithOutCommonEndpoint: The selected segment does not have a common endpoint with the previously selected one. Select another.
handlers.segmentWithOutEndpointOnLine: The selected segment does not have a endpoint on the previously selected line. Select another.
handlers.lineDoesNotContainEndpointOfSegment: The selected line does contain an endpoint on the previously selected segment. Select another.
handlers.antipodalPointMessage: The selected point is antipodal or equal to the first selected point. Select another.
handlers.antipodalPointMessage2: The selected point is antipodal or equal to the second selected point. Select another.
handlers.intersectionOneDimensionalSelected: One dimensional object {name} selected. Select another.
handlers.selectionUpdate: Selection Update: {number} objects selected. Hold the Alt/Option key to add or subtract from the current selection.
handlers.pointCreationAttemptDuplicate: There is already a point at this location.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointPointSelected: Point selected. Now select a one dimensional object to determine the perpendicular.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointLineSelected: Line {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointSegmentSelecte: Segment {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.perpendicularLineThruPointCircleSelected: Circle {name} selected. Now select a location to create a new point or to create a point on an object.
handlers.antipodeDuplicate: The antipode of this point has already been created.

objectTree.parserError: Reached end of input while parsing expression
objectTree.multipleOfPiToggle: Toggle the display of the expression in multiples of Pi
objectTree.toggleDisplay: Toggle the display of the corresponding object.
objectTree.firestoreConstructionSaved: Construction saved to Firestore with ID {docId}
objectTree.firestoreSaveError: Unable to save construction to Firestore

account.emailVerification: An account verification email has been delivered to {emailAddr}
account.emailNotVerified: Your account is not yet verified. Please check your email
account.passwordReset: A link to reset your password has been delivered to {emailAddr}
